featured.text: During the second Industrial Age, people toiled at unusual hours in mines or factories and often had to get up for work early in the morning.
The young generation in this country has shown less interest in factory work and other _____ labor jobs, such as house construction and fruit picking.
The fire in the fireworks factory in Changhua set off a series of powerful _________ and killed four people.
His father went to Paris to open a textile factory.

other.text: It requires fewer chemicals, making it safer for the workers in factories.
Since we are short of manpower in the factory, it is very ______

definition.zh_def: 工廠：一個用於生產商品的地方，通常有機械和工人。
definition.en_def: A factory is a place where goods are manufactured, typically using machinery and labor.
definition.example: The factory produces thousands of toys every day.
